dcat:dataset.dct:title: NAC Awards and Achievements
dcat:dataset.dct:description: This dataset shows Awards and Achievements bids for various teams and projects across the Council and any costs associated with them, if there were any, and the final result of the bid.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Health and Safety Incidents
dcat:dataset.dct:description: In the event of a Health and Safety incident arising out of, or in connection with, a work activity all employees have a duty to report the incident to their line manager as soon as practicable after the event. This dataset gives details of any incidents recorded.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Memorial Information
dcat:dataset.dct:description: Shows the location of Memorials within North Ayrshire cemeteries and also gives their Section, Layer Number and the Surname of who was buried there.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Housing Stock
dcat:dataset.dct:description: Shows all the Housing Stock owned by North Ayrshire Council. It shows the number of beds, the property type, the date acquired and the postcode sector of each property. The date acquired showed be used as an indication of property age and is not guaranteed to be fully accurate.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Cycle Paths
dcat:dataset.dct:description: This dataset shows the route of cycle paths within North Ayrshire. This includes National Cycle Network routes and other local routes as well.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Train Stations (NaPTAN)
dcat:dataset.dct:description: The National Public Transport Access Node (NaPTAN) identifies points of access to public in Britain. Every bus stop, railway station, ferry terminal in Britain (except for Northern Ireland) has NaPTAN record. This record includes location co-ordinates, (both Ordanance Survey Grid Finder number and latitude and longitude); National Public Transport Gazetteer locality reference number; name and SMS code. For more information go to https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-public-transport-access-node-schema

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Bus Stops (NaPTAN)
dcat:dataset.dct:description: The National Public Transport Access Node (NaPTAN) identifies points of access to public in Britain. Every bus stop, railway station, ferry terminal in Britain (except for Northern Ireland) has NaPTAN record. This record includes location co-ordinates, (both Ordanance Survey Grid Finder number and latitude and longitude); National Public Transport Gazetteer locality reference number; name and SMS code. dcat:dataset.dct:title: Homelessness - Action Taken by NAC
dcat:dataset.dct:description: This dataset is made up of answers to Question 22 in the HL1 homelessness questionnaire, action taken by NAC which it says is the discharge of its duty to the applicant, or the closure of the case in terms of the HL1.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Free School Meals by DZ - 2017/18
dcat:dataset.dct:description: This is the Free School Meals paid out by the Council by Datazone in 2017/18. Shown as a count in the datazone and also as a score out of 10. A Datazone is an area which has a population of around 500 to 1,000 residents.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Traffic Sensitive Roads
dcat:dataset.dct:description: Traffic sensitive roads have restrictions for road works which are applied according to various categories. This dataset shows the Traffic Sensitive Roads and Traffic Sensitive Side Roads within NAC.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Poverty Alleviating Grants Index by DZ - 2017/18
dcat:dataset.dct:description: The Poverty Alleviating Grants index was created from 18 datasets that are either a poverty alleviating grants (eg Housing benefit or free school meals etc) or dataset that gives an indication of poverty such negative rent balance or benefit enquiry). Every datazone in each of the data set has been scored 1 to 10 accordingly then the datasets have been weighed by how much the council spends and how big the dataset set as an indicator of poverty. This gives a combined score out of 10 for each datazone.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Housing Land Audit 2016
dcat:dataset.dct:description: Scottish Planning Policy ( SPP) requires that a five-year ongoing effective land supply is available to meet the identified housing land requirements. Planning authorities should therefore carry out regular monitoring of housing completions and the progress of sites through the planning process. This can be achieved through the preparation of a housing land audit, carried out annually by the planning authority in conjunction with housing and infrastructure providers.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Housing Land Audit 2021
dcat:dataset.dct:description: Scottish Planning Policy (SPP) requires that a five-year ongoing effective land supply is available to meet the identified housing land requirements. Planning authorities therefore carry out regular monitoring of housing completions and the progress of sites through the planning process. This is achieved through the preparation of a housing land audit, carried out annually by the planning authority in conjunction with housing and infrastructure providers.This update provides an overview of North Ayrshire’s Housing Land Audit (HLA) figures for the period April 2020 to March 2021. It includes details of housing completions for the 12 months up to 31st March 2021 and the future delivery programming of all housing sites within North Ayrshire.The Housing Land Audit monitors housing sites which have a capacity of four or more new houses and identifies and quantifies the land available for housing in North Ayrshire.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Vacant and Derelict Land Supply 2021
dcat:dataset.dct:description: The vacant and derelict land survey is undertaken annually to establish the extent and state of vacant and derelict land in North Ayrshire and the amount of land that has been rehabilitated since the previous survey.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Traffic Regulation Orders
dcat:dataset.dct:description: Traffic Regulation Orders (TROs) impose traffic restrictions such as road closures, introduction or varying of speed limits, prohibition of turns (such as right turns and u-turns) and introduction of waiting or loading restrictions.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Contact Centre Call Performance
dcat:dataset.dct:description: This dataset shows the number of calls in the council Contact Centre that have been answered, abandoned and redirected. It is shown as an absolute number and as a percentage of the calls for that period.

dcat:dataset.dct:description: This is the Education Maintenance Allowance paid out by the Council by Datazone in 2017/18. Shown as a count in the datazone and also as a score out of 10.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Homelessness - Previously in Armed Forces
dcat:dataset.dct:description:
This dataset is made up of answers to Question 10c in the HL1 homelessness questionnaire.

The length of time since any member of the household who has ever been a member of the armed services was in them.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Homelessness - Assessment Decision
dcat:dataset.dct:description:
This dataset is made up of answers to Question 17 in the HL1 homelessness questionnaire.

Statutory assessment decision as recorded by the homelessness officer.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Homelessness - Previously in Local Authority Care
dcat:dataset.dct:description:
This dataset is made up of answers to Question 10d in the HL1 homelessness questionnaire.

The length of time since any member of the household aged under 25 who was looked after as a child left local authority care.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Homelessness - Property Type Made Homeless From
dcat:dataset.dct:description:
This dataset is made up of answers to Question 14a of the HL1 homelessness questionnaire.

The type of property from which the person became homeless / threatened with homelessness – not necessarily the most recent address, as applicants may have been temporarily staying with friends / family having already become homeless.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Homelessness - Reason for Becoming Homeless
dcat:dataset.dct:description:
This dataset is made up of answers to Question 16a in the HL1 homelessness questionnaire.

The reason for homelessness as given by the main applicant.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Homelessness - Slept Rough in Past 3 Months
dcat:dataset.dct:description:
This dataset is made up of answers to Question 12 in the HL1 homelessness questionnaire.

Has any member of the applicant household slept outside, in the open air (such as on the streets, or in doorways, parks or bus shelters) or slept in a building or other place not designed for habitation (such as barns, sheds, car parks, cars, derelict boats, stations etc.) for at least one full night in the last 3 months.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Employment Land Supply 2017
dcat:dataset.dct:description: Scottish Planning Policy sets out the Scottish Governments policies in relation to economic development in Scotland. An Employment Land Audit is produced to monitor the supply, take up and status of employment land in line with National Guidance. The audit assesses the range and choice of marketable sites and locations for businesses with a variety of size and quality requirements. The audit identifies the availability and constraints of employment land sites within the local authority.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Housing Land Audit 2017
dcat:dataset.dct:description: Scottish Planning Policy ( SPP) requires that a five-year ongoing effective land supply is available to meet the identified housing land requirements. Planning authorities should therefore carry out regular monitoring of housing completions and the progress of sites through the planning process. This can be achieved through the preparation of a housing land audit, carried out annually by the planning authority in conjunction with housing and infrastructure providers.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Planning Applications
dcat:dataset.dct:description:
Development management is the process of deciding planning applications, including the appeals and review processes. Legislation defines what development activities require planning permission and that decisions are made in keeping with the Development Plan.

Development is defined in the legislation as the carrying out of building, engineering, mining or other operations in, on, over or under land, or the making of any material change in the use of any buildings or other land. The definition also covers changes of use which may not involve physical building work.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Building Warrant Applications
dcat:dataset.dct:description: The Building Standards Register is list of applications designed to meet the requirements of Section 24 of the Building (Scotland) Act 2003. This requires local authorities to keep a Building Standards Register for the geographical area of the authority.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Building Warrant Enforcement Notices
dcat:dataset.dct:description: It is an offence for anyone to carry out work to which the building regulations apply without a building warrant. Where the local authority’s Building Standards Service consider it necessary, a 'building warrant enforcement notice' may be served on the relevant person.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Vacant and Derelict Land Supply 2016
dcat:dataset.dct:description: The vacant and derelict land survey is undertaken annually to establish the extent and state of vacant and derelict land in North Ayrshire and the amount of land that has been rehabilitated since the previous survey.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: LDP2 - Local Nature Reserves
dcat:dataset.dct:description: LNRs  are  established  in  a  variety   of locations  with  very varied  habitats  and species.  They must lie wholly  within  the area of jurisdiction of the local authority which  declares them to be reserves.  Prior to  such  declaration, the local  authority must  own  or lease the site or  obtain  an agreement from the owner.   LNRs  are  generally smaller than NNRs  and closer  to centres of population. They  are frequently  provided for the enjoyment and education of local people whose involvement in site management is encouraged.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Domestic Waste Collections
dcat:dataset.dct:description: This dataset shows the bin collection days for domestic properties in North Ayrshire. Addresses can be matched by Unique Property Reference Number (UPRN) which is the unique identifier for every addressable location in Great Britain.

dcat:dataset.dct:title: Members Allowances and Expenses
dcat:dataset.dct:description:
The Local Government (Allowance and Expenses) (Scotland) Regulations 2007 as amended, require the Council to keep a record of payments made to Members and to publish the information for the preceding financial year (1 April to 31 March) by 1 June.

Under the Local Governance (Scotland) Act 2004 (Remuneration) Regulations 2007 as amended, there are four levels of remuneration payments for Councillors, depending on the responsibilities of the Councillor. These are the Leader of the Council, Depute Leader of the Council, Senior Councillor and Councillor. 

A Senior Councillor is a Councillor who holds a position of significant position of responsibility in the Council's Political Management Structure. All other Councillors, other than the Leader of the Council and the Depute Leader of the Council will receive the basic remuneration as prescribed by the Regulations. Remuneration is subject to income tax and national insurance deductions.
